keyword: how many calories in chargrilled chicken
title: How Many Calories in Chargrilled Chicken?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in chargrilled chicken per 100 g serving, including protein, fat, carbs, and nutrition breakdowns for easy meal planning.
h1: How Many Calories in Chargrilled Chicken?
assumptions: Skinless, boneless chicken breast, chargrilled without added oil or marinade; standard portion size.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by cut, size, cooking method, seasonings, and brand. Check labels or apps for precise values.

quick_answer.text: 100 g of chargrilled chicken breast provides about 165 kcal and 31 g protein.

label_note: Values align with standard Nutrition Facts labels for straightforward comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tsp olive oil for grilling per 100 g
Marinate with 1 tbsp BBQ sauce per 100 g

faqs.q: How many calories in 100 g chargrilled chicken?
faqs.a: Approximately 165 kcal for skinless, boneless chargrilled chicken breast.

faqs.q: What's the protein in chargrilled chicken?
faqs.a: About 31 g protein per 100 g serving.

faqs.q: Does chargrilling add calories to chicken?
faqs.a: Minimal if no oil is added; it can reduce fat compared to frying.

faqs.q: How many calories in a 200 g chargrilled chicken breast?
faqs.a: Around 330 kcal, doubling the per-100 g values.
Yes, 0 g carbs per 100 g, making it ideal for low-carb diets.
